results.title: Evolution
results.brief_description: A sly, funny “survey” of evolution from the earth’s beginnings till now. Sophisticated enough to entrance adult audiences, this film’s rollicking, outrageous humour will delight children. An intriguing discussion starter for biology and social studies courses. Finalist, American Film Festival 1981: Humour & Satire.

results.title: Evolution
results.brief_description: An animated film telling the story of how life came into being on this planet. The animator, Michael Mills, describes the process in this film - from the time when a single-celled amoebae romped about the ocean depths until the first amphibious creatures crawled onto land, eventually to become the progenitor of homo sapiens himself. (Winner of eleven awards.)

results.title: Evolution
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Columbia Pictures, Ivan Reitman, Joe Medjuck and Daniel Goldberg
results.brief_description: David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Seann William Scott and Julianne Moore star in this Sci-Fi comedy about a team of unlikely heroes trying to save the world from an alien invasion. Wayne Green, a wannabe fireman is practising for his fireman’s test when a meteor crashes into his car. He calls in the police who, in turn, call in college professor Ira Kane and his friend, geologist Harry Block. Together, they discover the meteor was carrying single-celled organisms which were evolving at a fast rate. When strange creatures appear in the area surrounding the meteor and start attacking the government is called in to investigate. When the trio discovers the government’s plan to destroy the aliens will actually cause them to reproduce faster, Ira, Harry and Wayne - with the assistance of Government scientist Allison Reed, attempt to save the day. Directed by Ivan Reitman, “Evolution” borrows jokes from his film “Ghostbusters” as well as from the hit film “Men in Black”. Cast also includes Dan Aykroyd in a cameo role as the Governor of Arizona.
results.creator_credit_for_label: NBCUniversal, Columbia Pictures, Ivan Reitman, Joe Medjuck and Daniel Goldberg

results.title: Evidence for the Ice Age
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description: Explains how anomalous geological formations such as moraines and erratics, polished and straited rocks, resulting from glacial action, show that much of the temperate area has been under ice sheets. For schools.

results.title: Evidence
results.creator_credit: Critical Art Ensemble, Claire Pentecost, Steve Kurtz and Igor Vamos
results.brief_description: Video evidence of the FBI raid of Professor Steve Kurtz’s home which led to his being charged with bio terrorism. The video has a voice over relating the history of events, and shows the aftermath of the FBI raids. This video was created specifically for the exhibition PROOF held in the ACMI screen gallery December 2004.

results.title: Everything You Wanted – Clubfeet
results.brief_description: Clubfeet’s music video for Everything You Wanted (2013) seems straightforward on first watch but was a complicated and technically ambitious feat to execute. Director Josh Thomas used a Red Epic at 5k resolution to film the clip in one take at 50 frames a second.
results.description: Clubfeet’s music video for Everything You Wanted (2013) seems straightforward on first watch, but was actually a complicated and technically ambitious feat to execute. Director Josh Thomas used a Red Epic at 5k resolution to film the clip in one take at 50 frames a second, with the masking out of each still pose achieved in post. The technique was so effective, it was controversially used in One Direction’s video You & I (2014), raising questions of inspiration, reinvention and duplication.
description_for_label: Clubfeet’s music video for Everything You Wanted (2013) seems straightforward on first watch, but was actually a complicated and technically ambitious feat to execute. Director Josh Thomas used a Red Epic at 5k resolution to film the clip in one take at 50 frames a second, with the masking out of each still pose achieved in post. The technique was so effective, it was controversially used in One Direction’s video You & I (2014), raising questions of inspiration, reinvention and duplication.

results.title: Everything you always wanted to know about supervision
results.brief_description: Highlights how a supervisor can develop skills to accomplish goals and objectives for the organisation and himself by mastering and consistently executing the fundamentals of supervision: organisation, delegation, communication, disclipine and motivation.

results.title: Everything under the sun [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: Who are the Australians? The film shows them at work, at home and at play. It depicts the sophistication of the cities and the sparseness of the outback. It reveals that already there are traditions and national pride. A study of Australia and Australians with all the variety and colour of the modern Australian scene. Note: A short version, intended mainly for overseas viewers, of “After Cook”. In English and Turkish.
